meanings.definition: The process in which colloidal particles come out of suspension in the form of floc or flakes.
meanings.sent1: During the flocculation, tiny particles clumped together to form larger flakes.
meanings.sent2: The flocculation of particles in the water made it easier to filter them out.
meanings.sent3: The flocculation of glitter in the craft glue created a sparkling masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her idea sparked a flocculation of thoughts in the brainstorming session.
meanings.sent5: The flocculation of stars in the night sky resembled a celestial dance.

meanings.definition: The formation of small clumps or aggregates in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The sudden flocculation of milk in the container surprised the chef.
meanings.sent2: Flocculation of sediment in the river caused the water to appear murky.
meanings.sent3: The flocculation of bubbles in the soda made it look like a fizzy party drink.
meanings.sent4: The flocculation of colors in the painting created a beautiful mosaic effect.
meanings.sent5: The flocculation of leaves in the pond resembled a floating garden.
